column4: Speaking of which, it's about time I insrtalled it again so I can run XP, forgot I hadn't put it back on since I decided to try the buntus again.
Still a pretty new distro when I used it before and was pretty unstable, seems to have improved quite a bit since then, though the lack of an actually root account still annoys me.
You're not required to not have a root password; but why does it annoy you?
sudo provides a lot more flexibility than just having a root account, which is one of the main reasons Ubuntu uses it
